intro: Selenicereus nelsonii, commonly known as the night blooming cereus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its spiny, segmented stems and nocturnal blooming habit. The plant produces large, fragrant white flowers that open at night and remain open for only a few hours. Its flowers are typically pollinated by bats and moths, which are active during the night. Selenicereus nelsonii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique blooming behavior.
